work.summary: Collaborate with GoDaddy's Productivity Panel team on internal projects.
Collaborate with GitHub's Pull Request team on internal projects and initiatives (such as reducing P50 and P99 latency). Pair program regularly with Senior Engineers on Pull Request team issues.

The Release Team recruits a number of apprentices for each release role, in order to train new release team leads, handle tasks that each lead may not be able to cover, share knowledge about the release process, and help contributors broaden their areas of knowledge and participation.

These apprentices are called shadows on the release team. The Shadow system is an apprenticeship model, like those used by union tradespeople. The idea is that Shadows learn by doing, while in the process taking load off the leads and improving the release. After unplanned developments, they may even end up taking over for their lead.

Set up an AWS EC2 instance to host a Flask application. Write tests using bash scripting, Postman, and PyTest. Implement CI/CD with Github Actions.

Collaborate with a team of 10 other fellows and learn to work across product & infrastructure to make sure services are reliable & scalable.

Plan over 20 technical workshops, recruit and coordinate with workshop presenters (Engineers, Product Managers, etc.). Create event schedule with programming director and team. Collaborate with Sponsorship and Marketing teams on sponsor challenges, workshops, and marketing event schedule.

Managed sales billing for the Seattle (and sometimes, Portland and Yakima) branches - billing over $35 million in revenue. Managed accounts payable and acted as the primary contact for over 100 vendors. Trained new hires on ERP software usage/processes and other aspects related to the position - created training/onboarding materials such as custom-made documentation & demos.

Supervised 120 residents and enforced student housing policies. Kept a duty phone for serving as on-call contact for residents in the event of emergencies, housing questions, and maintenance requests. Planned events for student housing residents.

work.position: Marketing Coordinator for Recreation & Fitness Division
work.summary: Designed advertising materials using Adobe Creative Suite. Managed all social media accounts (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter), responded to questions/concerns, and posted content.
